channel.title: Ars-Technica on Panz3r News
channel.description: Recent content in Ars-Technica on news.panz3r.dev

item.title: Delta variant slams Missouri as ICUs fill and ventilators run low
item.description: Cases and hospitalizations surge amid the low vaccination rates and the spread of delta.

item.title: Up to 1,500 businesses infected in one of the worst ransomware attacks ever
item.description: Mass compromise is having cascading effects around the world.

item.title: GameStop’s Summer Sale is live with a number of good Switch and PS5 deals
item.description: Dealmaster also has deals on MacBooks, the OnePlus 9, Roku streamers, and more.

item.title: Pentagon kills Microsoft’s $10B JEDI cloud contract, says tech is now outdated
item.description: Amazon’s legal stall tactics seem to have paid off.

item.title: NASA’s helicopter on Mars just keeps flying and flying
item.description: For NASA, taking some risk has paid off handsomely.

item.title: “Broadcom is a monopolist”: FTC orders chipmaker to stop illegal tactics
item.description: Firm “illegally” dominated set-top box and modem chips, must stop exclusivity deals.

item.title: No, open source Audacity audio editor is not “spyware”
item.description: The community’s telemetry concerns were received and addressed two months ago.

item.title: Bitcoin power plant is turning a 12,000-year-old glacial lake into a hot tub
item.description: Private equity’s cryptocurrency experiment pushes more costs on the public.

item.title: Microsoft’s Surface Duo falls even lower, now almost $1000 off
item.description: 71 percent off is a sad ending for Microsoft’s first self-branded Android phone.

item.title: Bentley has a new plug-in hybrid Flying Spur sedan on the way
item.description: First battery Bentley due in 2025; no more combustion engines after 2030.

item.title: Spiders eating snakes, oh my! Here are the photographs to prove it
item.description: Some species of spider can conquer snakes that are 10 to 30 times their size.

item.title: Peugeot plans to win Le Mans in 2022 with this 9X8 hybrid prototype
item.description: The French Lion last tasted victory at La Sarthe in 2009.

item.title: Meet the Switch Pro: $350 “OLED Model” launches on October 8
item.description: Bigger, brighter screen and a new kickstand, but no processing power improvements?

item.title: Evolution of the dad
item.description: Most male mammals have little to do with their kids. Why is our own species different?

item.title: Did lead poisoning cause downfall of Roman Empire? The jury is still out
item.description: A new video from the American Chemical Society revisits longstanding academic debate

item.title: The rumor is true: Rimac is taking over Bugatti with Porsche’s help
item.description: Ars spoke to CEOs Oliver Blume and Mate Rimac about the hypercar deal.

item.title: Old school: I work in DOS for an entire day
item.description: From the archives: Open source MS-DOS alternative lives—but using it nearly killed me.

item.title: The thorny ethics of displaying Egyptian mummies to the public
item.description: Exhibits are popular, but curators must grapple with issues of cultural, racial sensitivity.

item.title: AtGames Legends virtual pinball review: The better pre-built choice… mostly
item.description: Picky pinball pros will prefer AtGames’s product, but it packs its own pesky problems.

item.title: America’s “Smart City” didn’t get much smarter
item.description: Technical hurdles, bureaucracy, and the pandemic dashed many of Columbus, Ohio’s tech plans.

item.title: Sizzling science: How to grill a flavorful steak
item.description: Want to learn how cooking transforms beef’s flavor? Meat scientists have the answers.

item.title: Review: Warmly satirical Werewolves Within is comic horror with a heart
item.description: Josh Ruben’s second film is a worthy successor to An American Werewolf in London

item.title: The comics, award-winning sci-fi, and nonfiction we’re reading this summer
item.description: If your local library has reopened, here’s what to sign out immediately.

item.title: Is the “Dragon Man” skull actually from a new hominin species?
item.description: Homo longi’s place in our extended family tree is far from settled.

item.title: Getting what you pay for? A spin on the design-focused electric bike
item.description: What do you get from an electric bike that costs more than some scooters?

item.title: Wimbledon: The tech behind the world’s top tennis tournament
item.description: From the archives: There’s a surprising amount of cool tech for a 140-year-old event.

item.title: The great sleep divide
item.description: Sleep deficits are robbing poor people and racial minorities of health and earning power.

item.title: A $26 billion plan to save the Houston area from rising seas
item.description: Lawmakers are poised to decide the fate of this massive project.

item.title: Russian hackers are trying to brute-force hundreds of networks
item.description: Moscow’s Fancy Bear group has been on a password-guessing spree this whole time.

item.title: OpenZFS 2.1 is out—let’s talk about its brand-new dRAID vdevs
item.description: dRAID vdevs resilver very quickly, using spare capacity rather than spare disks.

item.title: Apps with 5.8 million Google Play downloads stole users’ Facebook passwords
item.description: Researchers uncovered 9 apps that used a sneaking method to pilfer credentials.

item.title: US hits anti-robocall milestone but annoying calls won’t stop any time soon
item.description: Large carriers deploy STIR/SHAKEN. Small carriers, old landlines are still problems.

item.title: German scientists built a high-resolution microscope out of Lego bricks
item.description: The only non-Lego components are the lenses, salvaged from smartphone cameras.

item.title: Qualcomm plans to design an M1 competitor for PCs—sans ARM
item.description: The first interview with Qualcomm CEO Cristiano Amon lays out the strategy.

item.title: New, deadly bacteria may be lurking in US; CDC warns of three puzzling cases
item.description: This isn’t the first time the deadly bacteria has surfaced in the US unexpectedly.

item.title: Despite $2.1M ruling, RomUniverse owner considers bringing back ROM site
item.description: Nintendo seeks permanent injunction after Storman fails to make $50/month payment.

item.title: OnePlus now has one of the best Android update schedules
item.description: Flagship OnePlus phones get three major OS updates, four years of security updates.

item.title: Facebook, Twitter pledge to fight abuse of women but leave lots of room for failure
item.description: Will they just throw more algorithms at the problem?

item.title: Tesla has great quarter, delivers more than 200,000 EVs
item.description: Tesla says it has done an outstanding job navigating supply challenges.

item.title: Thinking about selling your Echo Dot—or any IoT device? Read this first
item.description: Deleting data from Echo Dots—and other IoT devices from Amazon and elsewhere—is hard.

item.title: General Motors looks to California for its next lithium supply
item.description: The US automaker is investing in closed-loop extraction from the Salton Sea.

item.title: 30 under $25: A collection of good hidden gem games from Steam’s Summer Sale
item.description: If you want something different to play, allow us to highlight some deeper cuts.

item.title: Rocket Report: Super Heavy rolls to launch site, Funk will get to fly
item.description: “I am not allowed to talk about that.”
